intro: Ogcodeia venosa, commonly known as the veined ogcodeia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves with prominent veins, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Ogcodeia venosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
